in the US, an election in which people choose who will represent a particular party in an election for political office closed primary
a primary in which only voters who are members of a political party can vote for the candidates from that party in order to choose who will represent the party in a later election: They won't give up on their demand for a closed primary election.
See more open primary
a primary in which everyone who is allowed to vote can choose either party's ballot (= list of candidates) in order to vote for a candidate to represent that party at a later election: In an open primary, you can vote for a candidate from either party.
